tool.name: HyPhy-FADE
tool.description: : FUBAR* Approach to Directional Evolution (*Fast Unconstrained Bayesian Approximation)
tool.command: ln -s '$input_file' fade_input.fa && ln -s '$input_nhx' fade_input.nhx && echo $substitutionmodel > tool_params && echo `pwd`/fade_input.fa >> tool_params && echo `pwd`/fade_input.nhx >> tool_params && echo '$grid_points' >> tool_params && echo '$mcmc' >> tool_params && echo '$chain_length' >> tool_params && echo '$samples' >> tool_params && echo '$samples_per_chain' >> tool_params && echo '$concentration' >> tool_params && echo '$branches' >> tool_params && @HYPHY_INVOCATION@ \$HYPHY_LIB/TemplateBatchFiles/SelectionAnalyses/FADE.bf > '$fade_log'

param.name: substitutionmodel
param.label: Substitution Model
param.option: LG (Generalist empirical model from Le and Gascuel 2008)
WAG (Generalist empirical model from Whelon and Goldman 2001)
JTT (Generalist empirical model from Jones, Taylor and Thornton 1996)
JC69 (Generalist empirical model with equal exhangeability rates among all amino acids)
mtMet (Specialist empirical model for metazoan mitochondrial genomes from Le, Dang and Le 2007)
mtVer (Specialist empirical model for vertebrate mitochondrial gemones from Le, Dang and Le 2007)
mtInv (Specialist empirical model for invertebrate mitochondrial genomes from Le, Dang and Le 2007)
gcpREV (Specialist empirical model for green plant chloroplast genomes from Cox and Foster 20013)
HIVBm (Specialist empirical model for between-host HIV sequences from Nickle et al. 2007)
HIVWm (Specialist empirical model for within-host HIV sequences from Nickle et al. 2007)
GTR (General time reversible model; 189 estimated parameters)

param.name: samples_per_chain
param.label: Samples to draw from each chain

param.name: concentration
param.label: Concentration parameter of the Dirichlet prior

tool.help: FADE (FUBAR Approach to Directional Evolution) uses the same underlying algorithmic advances as impletented in FUBAR to apply Baysian MCMC accounting of parameter uncertiantiy to detect sites evolving under directional evolution in protien alignments.
